entry.title: Document Splitting – Overflow Error after Changes in Business Transaction Variant 0000/0001
entry.content:
I have a document splitting issue where additional categories were assigned in the business transaction and transaction variant 0000/0001 for the GRN (Goods Receipt Note) process.

After this, the system started throwing "Document Splitting causes field overflow for currency type Quantity - GLT0004". SAP recommends reverting the configuration to the standard settings, but I am not sure about the impacts of doing so or the best approach to perform this adjustment.

Could anyone please assist or share guidance on how to proceed?

entry.title: KSS2 - Incorrect Control Cost Calculation
entry.content:
Hi There,

KSS2 calculated control costs in a way that we keep our heads scratching. 

  • We have a Cost Centre with multiple cost elements posted.
  • On this CC, there are 5 Activity Types posted as process costs.
  • All cost elements posted are mapped to activities posted. There is no loose cost element. Any costs element which are not linked to posted activities were reversed so their balance is 0.
  • However, there is one activity with confirmations which doesn’t have corresponding actual costs posted.
  • Not all activities posted through production confirmation, some of them were posted via KB21N.
  • We have Splitting Structure created in OKES and the Cost Centre is assigned to this structure in OKEW.
  • The Actual Price calculation method is set to Periodic in OKEQ.
  • There are a number of cost elements which are assigned to multiple assignments in OKES, however – please note – none of the cost elements posted on this Cost Centre are assigned to multiple assignments. All of the cost elements assigned only to one OKES assignment which mapped only to one Activity Type, so all Activity Type are assigned to only one assignment.
  • 4 activity’s prices will be calculated based on capacity, one based on quantity (act. price indicator are 6 and 5, respectively).
  • There are no Cost Elements, nor Activities planned, only capacity (except one which is not planned since it has act. price ind. 5 in the master data).

So, as we can see, from calculation standpoint we have a pretty straightforward, standard 1:1 set up, w/o cost element or activity overlapping for this period on this Cost Centre. The only thing which sticks out a little is the one activity which doesn’t have corresponding actual costs posted.

In the attached pic, you can see the peculiarity of calculating the control costs. There is a mysterious amount of 27.625 which was added or subtracted to or from original actual costs to arrive at control costs:

Any hints why is this happening are warmly welcomed.

Cheers

M.

entry.title: Company code splits
entry.content:
A customer has a potential project where they need to split one current company code into two (e.g. moving part of activity in one company code to another for on-going operations).  Some consulting firms say they can copy plants, sales orgs and purchasing orgs from one company to another vs. creating net new plants, sales orgs, etc.  This would save time and effort, but will this cause issues in the future?  Does this align with SAP's guidance and overall recommendation?  SAP Note 1595808 seems to advise against this.  Other thoughts would be appreciated.

https://me.sap.com/notes/0001595808

entry.title: Payroll EG Issue – Need to Process Salaries in Non-EGP Currencies for Foreign
entry.content:
We are currently facing a challenge in our SAP HCM Payroll configuration related to processing salaries for employees working in countries outside Egypt. These employees are assigned to companies that operate in different countries and pay salaries in local currencies (e.g., USD, KES, etc.).

However, when we run payroll using the Egypt-specific payroll driver (RPCALCE0), the system automatically converts all salary amounts into the Egyptian Pound (EGP), regardless of the company’s local currency. This behavior does not align with our business requirement, as we need to process and disburse salaries in the respective company currency, not in EGP.

We would appreciate your guidance on how to configure the system to support multi-currency payroll processing, ensuring that salaries are calculated and paid in the correct company-specific currency without being converted to EGP.

Please let us know the recommended approach or any necessary configuration steps to achieve this.

entry.title: Unable to submit quiz or mark lesson as completed on SAP Learning

Subject: Unable to submit quiz or mark lesson as completed on SAP Learning

Hello,

I am experiencing a technical issue on learning.sap.com, in the course “Outlining the Financial Accounting Overview in SAP S/4HANA.”

After successfully completing two quizzes, I now receive the following message each time I try to submit a quiz:

“Please refresh the course page to load the latest content.”

Even after refreshing the page multiple times, the message remains, and I can’t submit any quiz or mark new lessons as completed.

entry.title: Web service errors 403 and 401 after upgrade to SAP S/4HANA 2023 SP03 (Kernel 793, PL 300)
entry.content:
We are currently testing our SAP system after upgrading to SAP S/4HANA 2023 SP03 (kernel version 793, patch level 300) .

After the update, we encountered issues with incoming web service calls :

  • External systems accessing SAP using a server certificate receive:
    403 Forbidden - Certificate required

  • When calling the same web service using a client certificate, we get:
    401 Unauthorized

At the same time, the SAP system can successfully call these external systems (outbound communication is working properly).

Our configuration:

  • icm/HTTPS/verify_client = 1 (verified via SMICM)

  • Certificates are imported mutually and trusted on both sides

  • The same integration scenario worked correctly in SAP S/4HANA 2021

Has anyone encountered this behavior after upgrading to S/4HANA 2023?
Any suggestions on what might have changed in the ICM/SSL behavior or SICF authentication handling?

entry.title: How to handle different fiscal year variants and fixed asset depreciation when setting up two codes
entry.content:
Hi Dear Experts,

Subject: How to handle different fiscal year variants and fixed asset depreciation when setting up two company codes

Content:
We currently have two company codes that follow different accounting principles and fiscal year variants.
For example:

  • Company A follows Japanese GAAP, with a fiscal year from April to March.

  • Company B follows Chinese GAAP, with a fiscal year from January to December.

In this case, since the fiscal years are different, I believe we need to set up two separate company codes (company codes = ledgers).
However, I’m facing some issues and would like advice on the following points:

① Cost Accounting:
Because the fiscal years differ, should the cost accounting also follow the fiscal year variant?
Does that mean I should set up two controlling areas, each corresponding to one company code (i.e., one company code ↔ one controlling area)?

② Fixed Assets:
Suppose Company B adjusts the useful life of an asset or adds additional value in January.
Then Company B will need to recalculate depreciation starting from January.
However, for Company A, January still belongs to the previous fiscal year (not yet closed), so this recalculation may affect the prior year and cause inconsistent depreciation amounts between the two companies.

In this case, should I still create two company codes (or ledgers)?
And how should I configure the depreciation areas or related settings for fixed assets to avoid inconsistencies due to different fiscal year variants?

I can’t think of a clean solution for this situation, so I’d really appreciate any suggestions or best practices from others who have handled similar cases.

Please suggest.

Thank you very much.Best Regards!

SAP S/4HANA SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA SAP S/4HANA Finance for group reporting SAP S/4HANA Finance

entry.title: OData V4 facing CSRF error
entry.content:
We have this iflow that was fully working (last successful run October 21) No changes has been made since October 10.
The CSRF Token issue was first recorded on October 27 and has persisted since.

Setting and configuration.

HTTP Session Reuse: On Exchange

OData V4: Connection: CSRF Protected is checked, Reuse Connection is checked. Process Operation is Patch. This setting used to work.
Consequently, we have an identical iflow, the only difference is it uses V2 instead of V4 and this one isn't facing the same issue.

This issue is occurring in DN2, SN2 and QN2

entry.title: OData V4 Delta Token (@odata.deltaLink) not returned for CDS View with ODP
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I am facing an issue with enabling delta extraction for an OData V4 service built on top of a CDS View. Despite the backend configuration appearing correct and the delta mechanism working with test tools, the OData service does not return the @odata.deltaLink.

I would appreciate any insights or suggestions.

System Information:

SAP S/4HANA ON PREMISE 2021

Release: 01 (02/2022) FP

CDS View Definition
I have created a custom CDS view with a C1 release contract, which is enabled for data extraction and delta handling via ODP.

Here is the code for the CDS view:

@AbapCatalog.sqlViewName: 'ZDELTATEST'
@AbapCatalog.compiler.compareFilter: true
@AbapCatalog.preserveKey: true
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Delta Test'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@AnalyticalQuery: true
@ODQ.enabled: true
@Analytics: {
    dataCategory: #FACT,
    dataExtraction: {
        enabled: true,
        delta: {
            byElement: {
                name: 'LastChangeDateTime'
            }
        }
    }
}
define view ZC_DELTA_TEST
  as select from I_SalesDocument
{
  key SalesDocument,
      SDDocumentCategory,
      SalesDocumentType,
      SalesDocumentProcessingType,
      CreatedByUser,
      LastChangedByUser,
      CreationDate,
      CreationTime,
      LastChangeDate,
      @Semantics.systemDateTime.lastChangedAt: true
      LastChangeDateTime,
      LastCustomerContactDate
}


2. OData V4 Service Exposure
The OData service was created using the standard ABAP RAP approach:

A Service Definition was created to expose the CDS view.

A Service Binding of type OData V4 - UI was created and published.

The service is active and can be called successfully for full data extraction.

3. Successful Backend Delta Test
The delta mechanism for the underlying ODP provider works correctly.

Using the report RODPS_REPL_TEST, I was able to perform an initial full extraction (F mode) and a subsequent delta extraction (D mode), which correctly returned only the changed records.

In transaction ODQMON, I can see the corresponding delta queue for the ODP, and the requests from RODPS_REPL_TEST are visible and processed correctly.

4. The Problem: No Delta Link in OData Response
The issue occurs when calling the OData V4 service from an external client (e.g., Postman).

The request is sent with the required header: Prefer: odata.track-changes

The service responds with a 200 OK status and the full data set.

However, the response payload does not contain the @odata.deltaLink, which is necessary for subsequent delta calls.

No new subscription for the OData consumer appears in ODQMON after the call.

It seems there is a breakdown in communication between the OData V4 service layer and the underlying ODP framework, preventing the delta subscription from being created.

Has anyone encountered a similar issue on this S/4HANA version or has any idea what configuration step or authorization might be missing specifically for the OData V4 delta token mechanism?

Thank you in advance for your help.

entry.title: F150 Mahndruck Sprache Standardtexte
entry.content:
Hallo SAP-Support,

wir suchen nach einer Möglichkeit die Sprache für die Standardtexts zu beeinflussen und von KNA1 abzuweichen. Eine analoge Logik wie in 2632165 wäre ideal:

  1. Empfängersprache (KNA1)
  2. Englisch
  3. Anmeldesprache
  4. Sprache des Textes, wenn dieser nur in einer einzigen Sprache vorhanden ist

Wir nutzen PRINT_DUNNING_NOTICE_SF und wollen in einem Mahnverfahren nur in DE oder EN kommunizieren und die Texte auch nur in diesen beiden Sprachen pflegen.

Vielen Dank!

entry.title: Error replicating business partner (customers) from Sales Cloud v2 to S/4HANA on-premise
entry.content:
Hello dear SAP community,
We are currently trying to replicate business partners (customers) from our Sales Cloud v2 to our S/4HANA on-premise and are currently receiving the following error message:

After receiving the error message, I started the debugger and found that the error occurs at the source code:

S/4 cannot find a logical system for the sending business system (Sales Cloud v2) and therefore aborts the import of the customer. Do you know where in Customizing/Development the logical system still needs to be stored for the sending business system?

We have implemented  BAdI MDG_IDM_GET_LCL_SYSTEM the following way:

For the logical system the BAdI deteremines the receiving system (S/4HANA).

We have also maintained a mapping between the business system and logical system for the Sales Cloud v2:

We do not use System Landscape Directory (SLD). We have based our approach on the 6KO integration guide https://support.sap.com/content/dam/SAAP/Sol_Pack/S4O/Library/Setup/6KO_S4HANA2023_Set-Up_EN_XX.pdf, the replication of business partners (customers) from the S/4HANA to Sales Cloud v2 already works.

Do you have any further advice for us?

Best Regards

Omid

entry.title: Services for Objects not working properly from Fiori tile;

Basis team already confirmed that there are no logs related to it in last 30 days.

Is it due to any performance issue ? could you please check and let us know.

entry.title: S/4HANAの新リース会計基準対応について
entry.content:
固定資産の新リース会計基準改正については、２０２７年（令和９年）４月１日以降に開始が国税庁から公表されております。

 

S/4HANAの対応のノート（ケース）を検索しましたが見当たりません、公開されておりますか、または公開予定はありますか？

 

教えてだきたくお願いいたします。
